Class VariableSizeRepeatingGroupIterator

java.lang.Object
express.mvp.myra.codec.runtime.struct.VariableSizeRepeatingGroupIterator
public final class VariableSizeRepeatingGroupIterator extends Object
A zero-allocation iterator for repeating groups of variable-size elements.

Wire Format (Offset Table Encoding): 

[count:int32][offset0:int32][offset1:int32]...[offsetN-1:int32][element0_data][element1_data]...

Each offset is relative to the start of the element data region (after the offset table). This enables O(1) random access to any element regardless of its size.

Thread Safety: This class is NOT thread-safe. Each thread should use its own iterator instance. The iterator can be reused by calling wrap(MemorySegment, long).

Example Usage with Strings: 

VariableSizeRepeatingGroupIterator iter = new VariableSizeRepeatingGroupIterator();
iter.wrap(segment, offset);
int count = iter.count();
Utf8View view = new Utf8View();
for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
    iter.getStringAt(i, view);
    String str = view.toString();
}

Example Usage with Nested Messages: 

VariableSizeRepeatingGroupIterator iter = new VariableSizeRepeatingGroupIterator();
iter.wrap(segment, offset);
LevelFlyweight flyweight = new LevelFlyweight();
for (int i = 0; i < iter.count(); i++) {
    iter.wrapElementAt(i, flyweight);
    long price = flyweight.getPriceNanos();
}
See Also:
  • for fixed-size elements

      public static final int COUNT_SIZE
      Size in bytes of the count field (int32).
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • OFFSET_ENTRY_SIZE

      public static final int OFFSET_ENTRY_SIZE
      Size in bytes of each offset entry (int32).
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • VariableSizeRepeatingGroupIterator

      public VariableSizeRepeatingGroupIterator()
      Creates a new iterator for variable-size elements.

  • Method Details

    • wrap

      public void wrap(@NonNull MemorySegment segment, long offset)
      Wraps this iterator around a memory segment at the specified offset.
      Parameters:
      segment - the memory segment containing the repeating group data
      offset - the offset within the segment where the group starts
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if segment is null

    • count

      public int count()
      Returns the number of elements in this repeating group.
      Returns:
      the element count (non-negative)

    • isWrapped

      public boolean isWrapped()
      Checks if this iterator is currently wrapped around a segment.
      Returns:
      true if wrapped, false otherwise

    • headerByteSize

      public int headerByteSize()
      Returns the total size of this repeating group header in bytes (count + offset table). Does not include element data.
      Returns:
      header byte size = COUNT_SIZE + (count * OFFSET_ENTRY_SIZE)

    • getElementLength

      public int getElementLength(int index)
      Gets the length of an element at the given index. Calculated as the difference between consecutive offsets, or the remaining data size for the last element.
      Parameters:
      index - the element index (0-based)
      Returns:
      the length in bytes of the element

    • getElementOffset

      public long getElementOffset(int index)
      Returns the absolute offset within the segment where element data starts.
      Parameters:
      index - the element index (0-based)
      Returns:
      the absolute offset of the element data
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range

    • getStringAt

      public void getStringAt(int index, express.mvp.roray.ffm.utils.memory.Utf8View view)
      Reads a string element at the specified index into the provided Utf8View. The view is wrapped around the string data for zero-copy access.

      Element Format: [length:int32][utf8_bytes]

      Parameters:
      index - the element index (0-based)
      view - the Utf8View to wrap around the string data
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range

    • forEachString

      public void forEachString(Consumer<express.mvp.roray.ffm.utils.memory.Utf8View> consumer)
      Iterates over all string elements, invoking the consumer for each. The same Utf8View instance is reused for each element.
      Parameters:
      consumer - the consumer to receive each string view

    • wrapElementAt

      public <T extends express.mvp.roray.ffm.utils.memory.FlyweightAccessor> T wrapElementAt(int index, T flyweight)
      Wraps a flyweight accessor at the element position for the given index. This enables zero-copy access to nested message fields.

      Element Format: Directly encoded message bytes (no length prefix at element level - length is in the offset table).

      Type Parameters:
      T - the flyweight type
      Parameters:
      index - the element index (0-based)
      flyweight - the flyweight to wrap at the element position
      Returns:
      the same flyweight instance, now wrapped at the element position
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range

    • forEach

      public <T extends express.mvp.roray.ffm.utils.memory.FlyweightAccessor> void forEach(T flyweight, Consumer<T> consumer)
      Iterates over all nested message elements, invoking the consumer for each. The same flyweight instance is reused and re-wrapped for each element.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the flyweight type
      Parameters:
      flyweight - the flyweight to reuse for each element
      consumer - the consumer to receive each wrapped flyweight

    • getBytesAt

      public MemorySegment getBytesAt(int index)
      Returns a slice of the underlying segment containing the bytes at the given index.

      Element Format: [length:int32][raw_bytes]

      Parameters:
      index - the element index (0-based)
      Returns:
      a MemorySegment slice containing the bytes data
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range

    • segment

      public MemorySegment segment()
      Returns the underlying memory segment.
      Returns:
      the wrapped segment, or null if not wrapped

    • dataRegionStart

      public long dataRegionStart()
      Returns the start of the data region (after offset table).
      Returns:
      the absolute offset where element data begins

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets this iterator, releasing the reference to the segment.
